title: Example-Based Language Learning to Foster Problem-Solving Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental grasp of language structures and experience with simple problem-solving
context.additional_context: Real-time interactive classes conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, with learners aiming to develop intermediate language skills for job preparation.

learning_goals: Learners can generate and evaluate at least three possible solution hypotheses to solve given language problems
Learners can identify correct problem-solving rules with 80% accuracy through example analysis
Learners can optimize the problem-solving process by revising incorrect hypotheses based on feedback

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
